instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1278 820-2936-B 3 beeps
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an A1278 820-2936-B with 3 beeps. I've already replaced with known good RAM modules, but the problem persists.

I can't see nothing damaged on the board, and I don't know where to start. 

Can you help?

threads.title: A1278 820-2936-B 3 beeps
threads.message:
Possibly damaged RAM slots.
BTW, did you try with PC3-8500 too?

Use DDR3 test card to see which connections are bad.

threads.title: A1278 820-2936-B 3 beeps
threads.message:
Hi,

I've tried with an PC3-8500S  but same result.

I don't have a DDR3 Test card. What can I do withou it?

threads.title: A1278 820-2936-B 3 beeps
threads.message: Clean RAM slots, resolder some pads...

threads.title: A1278 820-2936-B 3 beeps
threads.message:
RAM clean and pads resolder had the same result.

Any other idea that I can try?

threads.title: A1278 820-2936-B 3 beeps
threads.message:
There must be RAM slots, or CPU problem.
Communication bus between RAM and CPU is broken somewhere.

threads.title: A1278 820-2936-B 3 beeps
threads.message: I can't figure out the problem. Any idea so I can try?

threads.title: A1278 820-2936-B 3 beeps
threads.message: Get the RAM test cards; full kit DDR2/3/4...

threads.title: A1278 820-2936-B 3 beeps
threads.message: Can you recommend any link suplier for those?

threads.title: A1278 820-2936-B 3 beeps
threads.message:
I bought them long time ago.
